text:
Harry Thomas Edwards (born November 3, 1940), an American politician, lawyer and legal scholar. He is a Senior United States Circuit Judge and chief judge emeritus of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit in Washington, D.C.. In 1980, he was nominated to the court by President Jimmy Carter.
He is a professor of law at the New York University School of Law.

annotations.surface_form: United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit
New York University School of Law
